title: Louvre heist puts French museums on high alert
subhead: Seven cultural institutions in France experienced burglaries with increasingly violent methods between September and October, revealing significant shortcomings in their security measures.

title: Nearly a year after California's devastating wildfires, Altadena's residents fear gentrification
subhead: Not incorporated into Los Angeles County, this California town has long served as a refuge for many African-American families. But the devastation caused by the January 2025 wildfire has pushed many homeowners, not all of them Black, to put their properties up for sale.
byline: By Arnaud Leparmentier (Altadena (United States) special correspondent)

Thomas Piketty: 'The true enemy of the nationalist and extractivist right embodied by Trumpists is the global social-democratic left'
subhead: The year 2025 was marked by the shock of Donald Trump's return to the White House. An unprecedented wave of extreme brutality has shaken the world like never since 1945, observes the economist in his column.

title: 'La Cage aux Folles': Paris reclaims the flamboyant musical
subhead: French audiences mostly know 'La Cage aux Folles' from the film adaptation of Jean Poiret's play, featuring Michel Serrault's exuberant performance. But it is also a triumphant Broadway classic, freed from clichés about homosexuality. Now, director Olivier Py and actor Laurent Lafitte bring the musical to the Théâtre du Châtelet in Paris.
byline: By Joëlle Gayot and Clément Ghys

title: Paris region inaugurates its first cable car
subhead: The C1 cable car line opened on December 13, connecting the south-eastern Paris suburbs of Créteil and Villeneuve-Saint-Georges. This new mode of urban transport is attracting the interest of many local governments.
byline: By Emeline Cazi and Jonathan Parienté
